Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Adepantin-1 (Gly-rich; Automatically Designed Peptide antibac-terial 1; synthetic AMPs20, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Its unusual primary structure with seven glycine residues is ~50% identical to any known helical AMP, being closest to bombinin (BMN_BOMVA, accession P01505, 50% identity). The original L9-P18 peptide has been merged into AP00494.
Literature Information.Author: Juretic D, Vukicevic D, Ilic N, Antcheva N, Tossi A. 2009
Literature Information.Reference: J Chem Inf Model. 2009 Dec;49(12):2873-82. doi: 10.1021/ci900327a.PubMed.
Literature Information.Title: Computational design of highly selective antimicrobial peptides.
